<JD_START>
Job Title: Administrative Supervisor Nursing

Location: Oneonta, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Job Description

 Job Description  The best thing about this role

Are you looking to make a difference by improving the health of our patients? Here you will find an innovative culture that is patient-focused and dedicated to making a difference. We are committed to helping the population we serve, and our communities, achieve optimum health and enjoy the best quality of life possible. Recently named a Forbes America's Best-In-State Employer 2022!

What You'll Do

The Administrative Supervisor Nursing provides consistent on-site administrative coverage for the hospital and is responsible for coordinating the operations of the hospital on his/her assigned shift. Is responsible for coordinating patient placement consistent with care needs and resources, staffing reallocations and patient flow, accepting all patients meeting our capacity criteria. Assists with direct and indirect care as needed. Functions as a consultant and educator for all inpatient staff including Nursing, ED, Bed Management, Laboratory, Radiology and Pharmacy. Supervises the shift Staffing Assistant, providing direction as needed. Functions as the on-site administrator, addressing patient and staff complaints, media inquires and emergency preparedness.

 Establishes and maintains a leadership presence in order to provide administrative and clinical support to all staff. Maintains collegial relationships with the interdisciplinary team to promote optimum care of patients.  Evaluates staffing levels and patient care acuity and negotiates staff allocation decisions to match patient care requirements and measured by managerial observation and feedback from unit resource nurses.  Provides consultation to Bed Management Services for coordination of patient acceptance and appropriate patient placement to the unit where staffing resources are best matched to meet patient needs as measured by managerial observation and co-worker feedback.  Follows defined procedures and policies while exercising judgment on issues as measured by feedback from co-workers and Managers.  Provides leadership to organizational staff in all departments on assigned shift and appropriately exercises authority to act on behalf of the Managers as measured by co-workers and managerial feedback.  Participates in Professional Practice activities and educational offerings as measured by documentation forwarded to manager  Participates in interdisciplinary managerial meetings that includes the Emergency Department, Inpatient Nursing, Perioperative services, Laboratory Services, Radiology services to ensure all issues are addressed regarding patient management as measured by manager feedback.  Provides meal coverage to units with one RN, and covers for other staff as needed for both clinical and clerical support as measured by co-worker feedback.  Provides clinical assistance to units as requested and to meet the demands of patient care for periods of the shift as measured by co-worker feedback and managerial observation.  Collaborates effectively with intradepartmental co-workers, with members of the interdisciplinary team, with patients and the public as reflected by staff and patient feedback.  Participates in organizational initiatives such as committees, JCAHO preparation, etc. as requested and as documented.  Role models effective relationship building on assigned shift and responds appropriately to complaints as measured by feedback from patients, families and nursing staff.  Observes and guides staff behaviors to help improve customer service relationships when addressing patient / family problems as measured by feedback and documentation from Nurse Managers and on the 24 hour Nursing Report.  Supervises and oversees functioning of Staffing Assistant for assigned shift (as reflected by input to performance appraisal) and assigns those duties in her absence as measured by co-worker feedback and managerial observation.  Promotes appropriate use of material resources such as rental equipment and strives to limit waste as measured by supervisory observation.  Demonstrates effective time management skills as measured by supervisory observation and co-worker feedback.  Provides clinical and educational support to staff. Participates in performance improvement activities and routine documentation reviews  Provides regular effective mini-educational sessions with clinical staff as planned with OD and as measured by co-worker feedback and managerial observation.  Collaborates with Managers, acute care staff, OD and Risk Management concerning process improvement opportunities as measured by co-worker feedback and managerial observation.  Functions as a resource on current departmental and organizational information as measured by supervisory observation and co-worker feedback.  Leads change processes as requested and provides follow up monitoring and remedial action as measured by co-workers feedback and managerial observation.  Offers and receives feedback on own performance, setting appropriate goals for practice and professional growth as measured by supervisory observation and co-worker feedback.  Ensures that patient information is kept private and confidential 100% of the time as measured by patient and co-worker feedback and managerial observation.  Acquires and maintains current knowledge and skills in his or her area of practice.  Provides proof of current BLS validation to supervisor.  Maintains relevant clinical competencies and knowledge base as reflected in Continuing Education Records and supervisor observation.  Completes required credentialing according to departmental policy by providing documented evidence of completion to supervisor.  Provides to supervisor evidence of completion of PC-based age-specific competency education for targeted age groups within the previous calendar year.  Participates in educational activity related to job function annually and provides documented evidence of attendance or activity to supervisor.  Demonstrates clinical problem-solving ability through written exemplar, patient/family feedback, co-worker report or direct managerial observation.  Demonstrates operational problem-solving ability through written exemplar, co-worker report or direct managerial observation.  Contributes to the body of nursing knowledge through use of research and participation in professional practice committees and organizations as measured by portfolio review and managerial observation.  Performs other duties as requested and observed by supervisor or manager. 

Education/Qualifications

What we need from you

 2 year / Associate Degree in Nursing, required All RN’s hired and do not currently hold a BSN will be expected to demonstrate enrollment in a bachelor’s prepared nursing program within 4 years of hire. BSN must be completed within 10 years. RN’s licensed on or before 12/19/17 are/remain exempt from this requirement.  4 year / Bachelor Degree in Nursing preferred; completion required within one year from date of hire  Master’s Degree in healthcare related field with an additional 2 years of below experience may be considered 
Experience

 A minimum of 5 years of progressive experience in nursing beginning at the staff nurse level with assumption of positions of increasing responsibility, required 

Licensure/Certificates

 NYS Licensure as a Registered Nurse, required  BLS and ACLS must be obtained within 6 months of date of hire, required 

Skills

 Accountability  Adaptability  Advocacy  Attention to Detail  Career Development  Clinical Skills  Decision Making  Goal Setting  Leadership 

Physical Requirements

 Medium Work - Exerting up to 50 lbs. for force occasionally, and/or up to 20 lbs. of force frequently, and/or up to 10 lbs. of force constantly to move objects.  Occasional balancing, climbing, crouching, kneeling, lifting, pulling, pushing, reaching, stooping  Frequent fit testing  Constant typing/clerical/dexterity, grasping, hearing, repetitive motion, seeing/monitor/computer use, standing, talking, visual acuity (color, depth, perception), walking 

Hazards

 Occasional radiation/radiant energy  Frequent bodily fluids/bloodborne exposure 

Working Conditions

 Occasional noise 

Travel

 Occasional Travel - The job may require travel from time-to-time, but not on a regular basis 

Total Rewards

Benefits

Bassett Healthcare Network’s commitment to our employees includes benefit programs carefully designed with the needs and values of all our employees in mind. Many of the benefits we offer are paid fully or in large part by Bassett. Our generous benefits offerings include:

 Paid time off, including company holidays, vacation, and sick time  Medical, dental and vision insurance  Life insurance and disability protection  Retirement benefits including an employer match  And more! 

Specific benefit offerings may vary by location and/or position.

We are also offering a sign-on bonus for this position! Details and eligibility requirements will be discussed during the interview process. Current employees of Bassett Healthcare Network are not eligible and are encouraged to apply through the internal job board.

This position is eligible for a sign on bonus up to:

USD $35,000.00

Pay Transparency

Salary is based on a variety of factors, including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, education, licenses, specialty, training, and fair market evaluation based on industry standards. The above compensation range represents a good faith belief of the compensation range by Bassett Healthcare Network, and its entities and affiliates, at the time of this posting or advertisement.

Pay Range Minimum

USD $43.93/Hr.

Pay Range Maximum

USD $65.89/Hr.

We love the difference people bring

We provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related condition), age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (including transgender status), genetic predisposition or carrier status, military or veteran status, familial status, status as a victim of domestic violence, or any other status protected by law.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
